sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Gosper curve.
message_1: What is the ratio of the perimeter of the 4th iteration of the Gosper curve to the perimeter of the 3rd iteration?
message_2:
The Gosper curve, also known as the Gosper Island or the flowsnake, is a fractal curve that increases its length with each iteration. The ratio of the perimeter of one iteration to the previous iteration is constant.

For the Gosper curve, this ratio is 7/3. Therefore, the ratio of the perimeter of the 4th iteration to the perimeter of the 3rd iteration is also 7/3.
